chargeHist.descr: Possess Methamphetamine with intent to deliver - 2nd offense(<=3g)

result.execSummary:
The defendant Raymond A. ROGERS was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess Methamphetamine with intent to deliver(<=3g), a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1m)(e)1.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Concurrent with the sentences imposed on 16 CF 194 and with the sentences presently being served on Sheboygan County case no: 15 CF 392 and 15 CF 324.

superMiscConds.notes: If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.
Maintain full-time employment or work search.

Pay supervision fees in an amount to be determined by the Department of Corrections.

Submit to random urine screens and pay for same.

Maintain absolute sobriety.

Assessment, treatment, counseling as deemed appropriate by the Department's assessment process.

Any counseling as deemed appropriate by the agent.

No contact with any know drug dealers or users.

Minutes.
RE:  Possess Methamphetamine with intent to deliver - 2nd offense, on 05-16-15.

Defendant in custody.  The State informs the Court that the defendant will be charged with the crimes of possess drug paraphernalia and possess Methamphetamine with intent to deliver.  The matters are continued for initial appearance on 06-08-15 at 2:30 p.m.  Bail is set at $10,000.00 recognizance bond with the conditions that he have no contact with Joshua Reed or Danielle Koch and maintain absolute sobriety.  Bail furnished and defendant is released from custody.
Minutes.
